page.title: 14BIRDS AT BRASTED SCHOOL
page.content: Every year in May,house martins come to our school from Africa repair nests from the year before and build new ones.They use the mud from the banks of the River Darenth.The nests are built under the eaves of the school roof and joined to the wall.The birds line it with soft material.sometimes one is occupied by a sparrow that has long grasses hanging out untidily. The martins eat insects caught on the wing.One partner with food swoops over the playing children until the other flies out to catch more food. To help the young to fly the parents take them on to the school roof and encourage them to fly to the ground. This continues until they are strong enough to migrate in October.Many perish on the way.
